title: Community Habilitation Specialist (Weekend)
description:
***YAI supports people of all ages with intellectual and developmental disabilities in achieving the fullest lives possible by creating new opportunities for living, loving, working and learning.***

**If you want a career supporting others, creatively finding solutions to life's challenges, and building a more inclusive community, YAI is the place for you.**

**Benefits of working with YAI:**

* **DailyPay** - ***Work today, get paid today!***
* Medical/Dental coverage for some part-time and all full-time positions
* Tuition reimbursement
* Paid Vacation/Holidays and Sick Time
* 403(b) retirement with employer matching contribution
* Life Insurance
* Discounts on travel, entertainment, wireless services, shopping, and more!

**About the position:**

***Community Habilitation Specialists work one-to-one with people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to help them pursue their life’s dreams by offering skills training and supports that allow a person to explore, experience, and enjoy life.***

**How you’ll perform the role:**

**Community Habilitation is an in-home and community-based service.** **As a Community Habilitation staff member, you will provide one-on-one support to people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in their homes and in the community. You play an integral role in teaching various life skills while providing recreational opportunities to promote community integration. The goal of this program is to empower the people we support to obtain greater independence, and to have fun along the way!**

Specifically, you would be...

· Promoting independence across settings in daily activities, such as work, learning, household maintenance, and leisure.

· Facilitating integration in the community's experiences and activities each day.

· Establishing a secure, positive environment that nurtures people's needs and self-expression.

· Delivering individualized skills training and care for people who receive supports in compliance with healthcare professionals’ instructions and other specific guidelines.

· Advancing people’s decision-making, productivity, and participation in a range of activities.

· Maintaining knowledge of people’s safety and health requirements.

· Complying with YAI’s policies and procedures as well as the specific rules of the person's home.

\\*Please note that the Community Habilitation Specialist position starts out part-time with potential to build a full-time schedule. **There are no overnight shifts for this program**.

**Cases are available in uptown Manhattan and the Bronx.**

**Typical start times**: 3/4pm

**Typical end times**: 7/8pm

Flexibility to work 16-40 hours per week!

**What we’d need from you:**

* High School Diploma or GED highly preferred; continued education in Psychology, Social Work, Art Therapy, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Physical Therapy, Nursing, or other disability services strongly preferred.
* Fluent English - reading, writing, speaking.
* Technology skills necessary to record observations and monitor development.
* Knowledgeable and comfortable with ADLs (bathing, toileting, traveling, dressing, grooming, cooking, etc...)
* Ability to participate in NYS Mandated OPWDD initial training during normal business hours upon hire.
* Tuberculosis test mandatory prior to the start date.

If you share our vision and want to help support people to live the fullest lives possible, apply now!

**YAI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* After school
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* Please note that the rate for this position is $18.00 hourly.

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Vice President of Operations
description:
**ABOUT BERLINROSEN**



BerlinRosen is a fast-growing, full-service communications firm with more than 300 communications and campaign strategists in New York, Washington, D.C. and Los Angeles. Since its founding in 2005, BerlinRosen has powerfully expanded its presence in corporate, social impact/ESG, nonprofit, entertainment, media, racial justice, healthcare, hospitality, lifestyle, technology, issue advocacy and workers' rights communications. We have received more than 50 awards and recognitions, including being the only agency to be named #1 on Observer's PR Power List for three consecutive years, PRNews' Large PR Agency of the Year (2023; 2021), PR News' Digital Firm of the Year (2023) and 5/5 Stars on Forbes' latest Best PR Agencies in America list.



People of color, people with disabilities and women are strongly encouraged to apply. BerlinRosen is committed to building and maintaining a diverse staff, and recognizes that its continued success depends on hiring and retaining high-quality creative professionals with a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Opportunities for advancement exist, and we are committed to helping all staff develop and grow.

  


**ABOUT THE OPERATIONS TEAM**



BerlinRosen's Operations team is comprised of over 30 operations experts who specialize in finance, talent, human resources, IT, legal and general operations. The Operations team supports the rapid growth of the firm by proactively identifying operational efficiencies and building the systems and infrastructure to scale sustainably.

  


**ABOUT THIS ROLE**



We are seeking a Vice President of Operations whowill lead internal projects, support and lead junior and mid-level staff and proactively make process improvements across the firm. This person will work closely with a wide range of staff from senior team leaders to administrative staff. This is a great opportunity for someone who stays cool under pressure and thrives in a fast-paced environment ripe with complex problem-solving opportunities.


**Role location:** This role is based in our New York, N.Y. office on a hybrid basis and in-office at least three days per week.

  


**ACCOUNTABILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS**



As a Vice Presidenton the Operationsteam, you will...


* Research tools, policies and make recommendations that will have long-term benefits for our staff
* Develop and execute strong change management processes to support firmwide changes and policy roll-outs
* Collaborate with team leads to ensure any firm-wide initiatives are effectively communicated and executed at the team level
* Respond to urgent requests from leadership and build systems to mitigate urgent issues in the future
* Work cross-functionally with Leadership, Finance, Operations, HR and other teams to successfully drive projects against deadlines
* Identify opportunities for improvement and eliminate redundancies, especially those with financial impact
* Plan, build and manage new firmwide systems and processes
* Manage vendors, software and procurement
* Coordinate firmwide events and meetings


**Essential skills:**


* 5-7+ yearsof managing operations for a mid to large organization, preferred
* Drive to learn new things and problem-solve off the cuff
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize work streams and track progress across multiple teams
* Excellent collaboration skills and the ability to contribute within a team setting, including excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Expert multitasking skills with the ability to handle multiple projects at once, work quickly and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment with high attention to detail
* Strong writing, editing and research skills with a penchant for paring down and presenting information in a clear and succinct fashion
* Ability to take initiative, maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion
* Excited by building and scaling a growing organization


**Preferred skills:**


* Experience in public relations
* Experience at a firm or agency
* Experience in mergers and acquisitions


**Note: Interested in this role but it's not quite the right match? Applicants who meet some but not all** ***or*** **exceed the above criteria are still encouraged to apply! We are eager to speak with candidates with diverse backgrounds and can assess role leveling on an individual basis.**

  


**WORKING AT BERLINROSEN**


**Compensation philosophy:** BerlinRosen offers competitive industry rate salary bands with the goal of retaining and growing talented individuals. We regularly review and adjust our compensation structure as needed to ensure equity across teams and levels.


**Salary range** (commensurate with experience and skills): $130,000-$170,000



Vice Presidents are eligible for end of year bonuses based on firm, team and individual performance.


**Benefits:**


* Medical, dental and vision insurance for employees and dependents
* Pre-tax Health Savings Account Savings Plan (HSA-SP) or Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* 401K with a 4% employer match and no vesting period
* Generous paid time off (PTO)
+ 20 vacation days, 10 wellness days, 1 day for your birthday, collective PTO between Christmas and New Year's Day, plus 11 holidays

* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Mobile phone reimbursement for data and minutes
* Employer-funded life insurance
* Discounted annual bikeshare membership
* Corporate discounts throughTickets at Work

  



#LI-BM1  

#LI-Hybrid

  


We're part of Orchestra, the first communications company built for today's media landscape. Since early 2022, it has grown into a network of eight strategic communications and marketing agencies including BerlinRosen, Derris, Glen Echo Group, Inkhouse, M18, Message Lab, Onward and Brightmode.


*To ensure that applicants are matched with the job that best suits their qualifications and interests, information that you submit may be shared with our network agencies.* *By providing your information, you are consenting to allow us and our subsidiaries to keep your information on file and to contact you regarding job opportunities, recruitment events and other related updates.*

title: Tax Specialist
description:
**Our Company**


Private investments such as venture capital, hedge funds, and private equity make up roughly 25% of the investment universe. Traditionally, investors, advisors, banks, families, and managers track hundreds of investments in complicated spreadsheets, file folders, and busy inboxes. Not only is this tedious and time-consuming, but it is rife with opportunities for manual data entry errors, inconsistent reporting, and lost information. Enter Arch.


Arch is a Series A financial technology company that automates the management of private investments, improving access, understanding, and the human experience of investing across asset classes. Arch delivers standardized data, documents, and insights in a single platform, avoiding the need to chase information across dozens or hundreds of fund manager portals.Our purpose is to save investors time while empowering them to make more informed investment decisions, leading to better financial outcomes.


We are a fast growing, dynamic company serving hundreds of clients, and we are looking to hire in all departments as we scale.

**Tax Specialist**
==================


We are hiring a **Tax Specialist** on our Data Operations team to play a pivotal role in providing strategic tax insights to support our business growth. In this role, you will manage complex financial data, ensure tax compliance for our clients, prepare necessary documents, and provide clear communication to clients. This role requires expertise in accounting, proficiency in Excel, and the ability to coordinate effectively across different teams.

**Key Responsibilities**
========================

**At Arch you will:**

* Act as a liaison between Operations, Sales, Product, and Support teams to ensure alignment on tax-related client requirements, product capabilities, and project deliverables.
* Coordinate with different teams within the company to ensure tax considerations are integrated into business operations.
* Streamline communication channels to address tax considerations effectively throughout the tax year.
* Stay updated on changes in tax legislation and assess their impact on our clients and our company.
* Have knowledge in tax documents pertaining to alternative investments and how they affect tax implications including, but not limited to: K-1, K-3, PFIC, 5498, 1099, 1099-R, etc
* Use specific knowledge to improve and inform Arch's tax offering
* Run our 1099 program: Coordinating receipt of 10's of thousands of 1099s across multiple institutions
* Lead our data quality initiatives with respect to tax document collection and processing, including coordination and development of internal data checks and providing training on best practices
* Serve as point of contact for clients, resolving tax related inquiries and providing exceptional service
* Own proactive tax outreach to fund managers, coordinating follow up, and ensuring information is properly maintained and updated in our database

**Reach out to us if you have:**

* Experience working with High Net Worth Individuals (HNWIs) and/or Single Family Offices, or familiarity with tax considerations in the alternative investment industry.
* Proficiency using Excel.
* Have proven experience in fund accounting, preferably with a background in a Big 4 accounting firm or family office/multi-family office setting.
* Proven experience in managing tax compliance, audits, and reporting for a complex organization.
* Analytical and problem-solving abilities, strong attention to detail, and are proactive in resolving issues as they arise.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, advocating for clients internally and providing exceptional support throughout the implementation process.
* High effectiveness even when faced with ambiguity; comfort in making executive decisions and moving projects forward.

**Bonus Points if you have:**

* Experience working at a large accounting firm.
* CPA certification with demonstrated expertise in tax implications within financial operations.
* Are familiar with the alternative investment industry and the mechanics of investing in private equity, hedge funds, and private companies or have a background in private banking, investment management, or a related field.

**Some perks of working for Arch include:**
-------------------------------------------

* **Strong Team –** You’ll be backed by a strong team that consistently exceeds client expectations and ships new products quickly.
* **Your work is high impact** - Being part of a small team means you have real responsibility and impact from day one. You'll be involved in discussions that drive the growth and direction of our platform from the very beginning.
* **You'll learn a lot about a lot** - The operations team functions across the entire company, from working with new and prospective clients, to liaising with the engineering team to build a new feature or improve an existing one.
* **Product Market Fit** – We have strong product market fit, exceptionally low churn, and have grown mostly organically through word of mouth.
* **Team community and camaraderie** – We have enormous trust in each other and always do what we can do to support one another. We're always ready to step in to help.

**Last note:**

* While we are no longer starting up, we remain culturally a startup; retaining the ability to nimbly serve our clients and innovate in everything we do, every day.


Compensation Range: $95K - $120K

title: Client Success Manager
description:
**OVERVIEW:**


**Play a vital role in Guidepoint's success.**



Guidepoint is seeking an entrepreneurial and outgoing individual to spearhead coverage of our Insights expert call and transcript library product for our corporate client base. As the primary liaison for our clients, you will play a pivotal role in driving engagement and revenue growth within the rapidly expanding Insights product line. Leveraging your exceptional CRM skills and keen attention to detail, you will collaborate cross-functionally to maximize usage of our offering among current clients and trial accounts. This highly visible position will involve working closely with the Insights group heads to develop strategic plans for enhancing client engagement and retention.



This is a hybrid role located in New York City.


**What You'll Do:**


* Serve as the primary advocate for the Insights product with corporate healthcare clients and foster three-dimensional relationships with key stakeholders
* Develop personalized engagement plans for each client dependent on company pipeline, to effectively market Insights content
* Monitor and drive client engagement through direct outreach efforts: direct emails, product demonstrations, virtual and onsite meetings
* Collaborate with sales team to ensure timely renewals and drive upsell opportunities
* Acquire valuable feedback and insights from clients to inform product development, marketing strategies, and sales efforts


**What You Have:**


* Bachelors or masters degree from an accredited University
* 3+ years of professional work experience, with a focus on B2B product sales for corporate clients
* Understanding of healthcare terminology and ability to engage with senior business leaders with innovative content and ideas
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to distill complex issues into clear and concise messages
* Experience working with or using expert networks is a plus
* Intellectual curiosity, adaptability, and a team-first collaborative approach
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a team, with a commitment to delivering results


**What We Offer:**



Starting compensation of $75,000 annually in addition to commission-based bonus.



You will also be eligible for the following benefits:


* 15 PTO Days, 10 legal holidays, and sick days
* Comprehensive Medical, dental, and vision plans
* Will match up to 10% of employee contribution for 401(k), life insurance, paid time-off and parental leave plans
* Commuter benefits and corporate discounts
* Development opportunities through the LinkedIn Learning platform
* Friday happy hour, "Summer Fridays", and free snacks and beverages in the office
* Year-round corporate athletic league
* Casual work environment, team building, and other social events


**About Guidepoint**



Guidepoint is a leading research enablement platform designed to advance understanding and empower our clients' decision-making process. Powered by innovative technology, real-time data, and hard-to-source expertise, we help our clients to turn answers into action.  

  

Backed by a network of nearly 1.5 million experts, and Guidepoint's 1,300 employees worldwide, we inform leading organizations' research by delivering on-demand intelligence and research on request. With Guidepoint, companies and investors can better navigate the abundance of information available today, making it both more useful and more powerful. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com.



Guidepoint is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.



#LI-DH1



#LI-HYBRID

title: Trust Accounting Analyst
description:
**Job Description**


**Location:** NY, NY (Midtown), Hybrid


**Position Overview:**



This position requires strong analytical, written and verbal skills which will give you the tools necessary to successfully complete your tasks and lend support to your colleagues.



Your pro-active nature, attention to detail, quality and proven organizational skills will provide the basis needed to initiate and work multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. You are committed to accuracy, excellent customer service, professionalism and going the extra mile.


### **ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*****:***


**Insurance Payables/Premium Receivables**


* Process timely premium payments to insurance carriers (via checks, ACH, Wire or online) to avoid notices of cancellation.
* Initiate Electronic Payments (ACH or Wire Transfers) to carriers through our preferred banking partner.
* Research and resolve payable discrepancies (premium, commission, billing etc.) with branch offices and/or insurance carriers.
* Research and respond to a high volume of inquiries (email & phone calls) timely and appropriately.
* Follow up for carrier invoices or statements through all the necessary channels.
* Apply or resolve return premium payments from insurance carriers.
* Depositing funds to bank
* Posting/allocating cash to client in agency management system
* Collaborate with third party administrators, such as ReSource Pro/Patra, on integrated workflows.
* Perform client account reconciliations as needed.
* Answer Accounts Receivable questions
* Process client refunds or pass-through payments for clients
* Generate Accounts Receivable aging reports and distribute accordingly.
* Work with Account Managers, Brokers, and Clients to collect premiums due.
* Act as a backup for other Trust Accounting team members as needed.
* File documents into our electronic filing system timely and accurately.
* Other duties and projects as assigned.
* **Resolution of billing discrepancies**
	+ Coordinate with Account Executives to resolve billing discrepancies
	+ Provide Account Executives with payment history to carriers as requested
	+ Refer problems/obstacles to Manager at huddle or immediately if urgent
* **Resolution of bank reconciliation items**
	+ Coordinate with Manager & Finance to resolve any bank rec items
* **Follow established workflow on NOC and Advanced Items**
	+ Communicate with the AE and track items pending NOC
	+ Follow the established workflow for Advanced Items and refer problems/obstacles to Manager at huddle or sooner if urgent.
* **Participate in morning huddle**
	+ Provide update on pending items
	+ Introduce any new issues that need attention
	+ Share responsibility of dedicated AP team email address
* **Request new ACH/Wire templates for new carriers and as carrier information changes**
* **Work toward achieving team and individual goals**
* **Additional projects/tasks as provided by dept manager**


***Personal*** ***AND Organizational Development Responsibilities:***


* Set priorities and manage workflow for self and support team to ensure all goals are met.
* Interact with others effectively using strong, clear communication skills, cooperating purposefully and providing information and guidance as needed to achieve the business, profitability and retention goals of EPIC.
* Stay informed regarding industry information.
* Project a professional image in action and appearance.

### ***KEY COMPETENCIES:***


* Excellent troubleshooting, decision making and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to partner with others to deliver on objectives.
* Strong knowledge Microsoft Office programs to include Advanced Excel skills (VLookups are a must, Macros and Pivot Tables are a plus).
* Strong attention to detail, multi-tasking, assigning priority and time management abilities.
* Ability to work effectively and efficiently both with and without direct supervision.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Must be able to commute to Jersey City, NY office (currently still remote).

### **REQUIRED SKILLS:**

title: Beauty Advisor
description:
**BEAUTY ADVISOR**

**Reports to:** Assistant Store Sales Manager, Store Sales Manager

**Direct Reports:** Non-Supervisory

**Primary Purpose:** The Beauty Advisor delivers an exceptional customer experience, drives store sales and maintains operational excellence. This role involves assisting customers with their beauty needs, promoting products, and ensuring a positive shopping environment aligned with company values.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Deliver exceptional customer service**: Provide knowledgeable and respectful assistance to customers, helping them find products that meet their beauty needs.
* **Drive sales results**: Actively engage customers and drive sales through effective selling techniques and product knowledge.
* **Maintain brand consistency in visual merchandising**: Ensure the store's visual presentation meets brand standards to enhance the customer experience.
* **Develop and maintain product knowledge**: Stay informed about new products, promotions, and company initiatives to assist customers effectively.
* **Conduct live product demonstrations**: Perform product demonstrations on clients, such as facial care, to showcase product benefits and drive sales.
* **Support store operations**: Assist with stocking, organizing, and maintaining the sales floor to ensure a clean and inviting shopping environment.
* **Build customer loyalty**: Create awareness of programs and promotions to encourage repeat business and build customer loyalty.
* **Participate in loss prevention**: Stay vigilant and proactive in preventing loss and ensuring the security of the store.
* **Support a safe working environment**: Adhere to safety protocols and contribute to maintaining a safe and secure workplace.
* **Demonstrate company values**: Uphold and promote the company's core values of Committed, Respectful, Demanding, Passionate, and Integrity.
* **Engage in personal development and philanthropic initiatives**: Participate in opportunities for personal growth and community involvement.

**All retail employees at Yves Rocher USA are responsible for:**

* **Driving top-line store sales results and growing the business**: Take passionate action to achieve and exceed sales goals.
* **Creating customer awareness of programs and promotions**: Build customer loyalty through respectful communication and service.
* **Setting personal goals and tracking performance**: Demonstrate commitment by setting and achieving individual and team goals.
* **Preparing for each shift**: Maintain awareness of all sales, promotions, and applicable POS procedures.
* **Taking initiative to recover and replenish merchandise**: Ensure merchandise availability aligns with the brand's demanding standards.
* **Understanding and adhering to visual merchandising brand standards**: Display integrity by consistently following brand standards.
* **Assisting in housekeeping of the sales floor and communicating maintenance issues**: Maintain a respectful and clean environment.
* **Building personal capability in loss prevention**: Stay committed to understanding and implementing loss prevention strategies.
* **Supporting all activities related to providing a safe working environment**: Show integrity in maintaining a safe and secure workplace.
* **Understanding and demonstrating company values**: Live and promote the company’s core values of Committed, Respectful, Demanding, Passionate, and Integrity.
* **Leading and participating in personal development and philanthropic initiatives**: Engage passionately in initiatives that promote personal growth and community involvement.

**Success Measures (as applicable):**

* Sales Goals and Comps
* Average Dollar Sales (ADS)
* Transactions Per Hour
* Loyalty
* Shrink

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in the beauty industry, such as retail sales in beauty and cosmetics, esthetician, or cosmetology is preferred.
* Ability to conduct live product demonstrations on clients, such as facial care, is required.
* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Demonstrates strong product knowledge.
* Schedule flexibility to include nights, weekends, and holidays.

**About Yves Rocher USA:**

Yves Rocher USA is committed to providing natural and sustainable beauty products while fostering a culture of respect, integrity, passion, and demanding excellence. We offer a dynamic work environment with opportunities for personal and professional growth, competitive benefits, and a commitment to community involvement and philanthropy. Join us in our mission to make beauty accessible and sustainable for all.

Expected hours: 20 – 32 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Evenings as needed

* Nights as needed
* Weekends as needed

* Garden City, NY 11530 (Required)

title: Kitchen & Bath Designer
description:
**Ring's End, Inc.** of **Wilton**, **CT** is looking for a skilled **full-time Kitchen / Bath Designer** to assist our sales team in showcasing our materials and services. This full-time position earns a **competitive pay** and is eligible for a **great benefits** package, including **traditional and Roth 401K, 3% 401K safe harbor company contribution, various medical insurance plans, FSA & DCA, employee discounts on our products and materials, life/accidental death & dismemberment insurance, long & short-term disability, paid holidays, paid time off (PTO), employee assistance program, and a legal counseling program**. Do you thrive in a **fast-paced environment**? Are looking for an **exciting position** with an established company? If this sounds like the Kitchen / Bath Designer opportunity you've been looking for, **keep reading!**

 **ABOUT RING'S END INC**


We are a Connecticut-based lumber and building materials retailer serving Connecticut, South County, Rhode Island, and Westchester County, New York. We are a third-generation, family-run company with a rich history dating back to 1902. Guided by a tradition of service and a commitment to innovation, we are dedicated to becoming the premier resource in the building material industry for builders and remodelers, painting contractors, architects, and homeowners.


Our growth and success are due to our team of professionals. We employ the best team in the industry, ensuring we maintain a **diverse** and **evolving** work environment that values **cooperation and teamwork**. We look for innovation and continuous improvement in everything we do. We're looking for more to join us!

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A BATH / KITCHEN DESIGNER**


As a Bath / Kitchen Designer, you are charged with the management of relationships with homeowners from initial contact through the construction of their project. You meet with clients to develop design ideas for their homes, compute budget ranges and price estimates, as well as select the various finishes. Designers meet with clients in our showroom or travel to a clients' home to measure. They back up sales with a commitment to quality and integrity. From designing kitchens and bathrooms to communicating with customers, you are busy every shift. **You offer the tools, systems, flexibility, and support for success and love seeing your projects come to life!** If this sounds like something you can do, you may be perfect for this Kitchen / Bath designer position!

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

* 5+ years of experience in kitchen design
* 3+ years in 20/20
* Knowledge of cabinetry and countertop materials
* Flexible and adaptable to the changes that rapidly affect the position


Are you an effective communicator? Are you organized and detail-oriented? Do you have a strong work ethic? Do you prioritize safety? Are you a respectful team player? Are you experienced as a kitchen designer or bath designer? **Apply today** to this Bath / Kitchen Designer position.

 **ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR DESIGN TEAM?**


If you feel that you would be right for this full-time design/sales position, please fill out our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application**. Apply today!

title: Fixed Income Quant Researcher
description:
Role Profile
This is a manager level role reporting to the Head of Fixed income Pricing and Modeling. You will be responsible for supporting, enhancing, and building outYield Book’s sophisticated analytics and supporting curve fitting, our term structure model, and pricing and risk for Mortgages, CMOs, fixed income derivatives, and corporate bonds. The daily activities will include assisting in modeling and monitoring of various curves, our term structure model, and
the pricing of other fixed income security types.
Key Responsibilities* Learn Yield Book’s fixed income pricing model, curve fitting model, and term structure model as well as risk


model such as VAR or FRTB.* Commitment to support and improve existing implementations.
* Applying quantitative skills to the modeling of the fixed income research.
* Willingness to learn data flows that support quant models, i.e. customize data storage and processing to


optimize for user experience, cost, and speed.* Support the effort to modularize existing suite of models.
* Learn our cloud platform and lead data processing and model development.
* Support research around the construction of new models.
* Understand model construction and paths to production.
* Coordinate with developers, data teams, broader research team, client services, and the product


Management team on python code, cloud, and research outreach.
Candidate Profile / Key Skills* Strong quantitative skill in mathematics and the numerical analysis is required.
* Advanced Technical degree in a field such as Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or Mathematics is preferred. PhD preferred.
* Strong working knowledge in C and C++ is required.
* Strong working knowledge of Python programming language is preferred.
* Working knowledge in the fixed income market is desired.
* Prior experience integrating data and models into production processes is desired.
* Prior experience producing buyside or sell-side research and publications is desired.
* Needs to be self-reliant and resourceful.
* Strong motivation and the desire and ability to innovate.
* 1-2+ years in a similar quantitative role is preferred.


Compensation/Benefits Information (New York applicants only):
LSEG is committed to offering competitive Compensation and Benefits. The anticipated base salary for this position is $133,400 - $248,000.
Please be aware base salary ranges may vary by geographic location, city and state. In addition to our offered base salary, this role is eligible for our Annual Incentive Plan (AIP/”bonus plan”). Target AIP rates will be commensurate with role level and posted career stage. Individual salary will be reflective of job related knowledge, skills and equivalent experience. LSEG roles (excluding internships and part-time roles of less than 20 hours per week) are typically eligible for inclusion in our LSEG Benefits program, which includes offerings of: Annual Wellness Allowance, Paid time-off, Medical, Dental, Vision, Flex Spending & Health Savings Options, Prescription Drug plan, 401(K) Savings Plan and Company match. LSEG’s Benefits plan also includes basic life insurance, disability benefits, emergency backup dependent care, adoption assistance commuter assistance etc.
LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.
Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject.
If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

title: Diesel Fluid/Lube Technician
description:
**Title of Position: Diesel Fluid Technician**  
**Shift: 2nd Shift- 2pm Start Time**

**Location: Belle Mead, NJ**  
**FLSA: Non Exempt** 

The Diesel Fluid/Lubrication Tech. will report to our stone quarry shop in Belle Mead, N.J. and spend their shift fueling, inspecting, and when applicable assist in the repair and maintenance of heavy quarry equipment and trucks. They will have a good working knowledge of tools, equipment. The nature of the work will require that the Fluid Tech**.** be able to spot problems associated with the equipment inspections. Fluid Tech**.** will demonstrate initiative, responsibility, have good interpersonal skills and be flexible/adaptive to a fast-paced and fluid business environment.

**Company Description**

Grow with us! The Silvi Group Companies have been working on expanding our “A” Team of employees since 1947! Our team has grown to 12 companies employing over 600 employees at 24 locations across New Jersey and eastern Pennsylvania Silvi is large enough to provide the stability you need, but small enough that you can feel your individual contribution to our success. We value the fresh ideas and perspective of each new member of our team.

Our employees contribute directly to our aggressive growth and we enjoy giving back by developing our employees with professional opportunities as well as a comprehensive benefits package. Our benefits includes excellent medical (health, Rx, dental, vision), personal time (vacation, sick, holidays) and a retirement package that not only includes a 401K plan but an almost extinct pension plan as well. We protect our employees’ futures by providing no cost disability and life insurance coverages with the option to purchase additional coverage as per their family's needs. Our close knit environment develops a culture in which we work hard but get to know each and every employee that helps us build our future. If you are driven, creative, and want to see your contributions reflected in real time, come work for us!

**Position Essential Functions Responsibilities**

* Check oil, grease and fuel trucks and heavy equipment daily.
* Check coolant levels, transmission levels, hydraulic oil levels, & engine oil levels
* Fuel all equipment daily
* Power wash radiators
* Report any issues found to mechanic on duty
* Perform tire inspection and tire inflations on all equipment at location.
* Change tires.
* Assist the mechanic with preventative maintenance for heavy-duty diesel vehicles and equipment.
* Assist the mechanic with driver write up’s
* Maintain a safe and professional working environment.
* Uses, stores, records, safeguards and properly uses equipment, materials, parts and other supplies.
* Maintain shop and work area in a clean and organized manner.
* Fill out fueling sheets with mileage and hours daily
* Prepare reports and records of time spent, materials, parts used and work completed.
* Complete work assignments in the allotted time frame

**Qualifications**

* Successful completion of training in automotive technology at an accredited school and/or the equivalent experience as a mechanic in the repair of motorized vehicles and equipment preferred
* Able to work second shift.
* Ability to work independently.
* Ability to read and understand maintenance and parts manuals, and other written instructions related to the maintenance and repair of motor vehicles and equipment.
* Knowledge of safety regulations, i.e. OSHA, MSHA, DOT as they apply to the operation preferred.
* Possesses a sense of urgency and ownership

**Physical Demands**

* Use hands to handle, control, or feel objects, tools, or controls.
* Stand for long periods of time.
* Kneel, stoop, crouch, or crawl.
* Hear sounds and recognize the difference between them.
* Make quick, precise adjustments to machine controls.
* Use fingers to grasp, move, or assemble very small objects.
* Make fast, repeated movements of fingers, hands, and wrists.
* Use one or two hands to grasp, move, or assemble objects.
* Use muscles to lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects.
* Use stomach and lower back muscles to support the body for long periods without getting tired.
* Bend, stretch, twist, or reach out.
* Move two or more limbs together (for example, two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm) while remaining in place.
* Hold the arm and hand in one position or hold the hand steady while moving the arm.
* See details of objects that are less than a few feet away.
* Use muscles to jump, sprint, or throw objects.
* Use muscles for extended periods without getting tired.
* Be physically active for long periods without getting tired or out of breath.
* Determine from which direction a sound came.
* See differences between colors, shades, and brightness.
* Quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out.
* Focus on one source of sound and ignore others.
* Lift 50 pounds regularly

No smoking is permitted on or within company property, including inside trucks, buildings, or anywhere on the premises.

title: Account Manager
description:
WHAT'S THE ROLE?


Our Account Managers serve as the go-to contact for our customers, embodying our purpose to make construction better by being their partner for productivity, safety, and sustainability. You will manage your own portfolio of customer accounts and be given ownership to build a work schedule that best suits you and your customers. You’ll make sales by maintaining customer relationships, demonstrating our latest tools on the spot, and providing high level customer consultation


WHO IS HILTI?


Hilti is where innovation is improving productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry, and beyond. Where strong customer relationships are creating solutions that build a better future. Where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 locations, carrying right into our lives and homes. Where people are exploring possibilities, leveraging their potential, owning their personal development and growing lasting careers.


WHAT DOES THE ROLE INVOLVE?


The purpose of the role is to create value in the allocated account's portfolio through effective design and implementation of individual account strategies to build long term, sustainable and profitable relationships with the customer. The role involves professional field sales and high level customer consultation in the defined territory within the target industry. The job holder needs to provide efficient solutions and technical support to customers and represent the Hilti brand in the market place.
  

Scope: Anchor job in Account Manager structure.


**Hilti North America has been consecutively recognized in Selling Power’s Top 50 Companies to Sell For in the last 18 years, coming in at #6 in 2023.**

WHAT DO WE OFFER?


Our account managers earn between $54,000 – $75,000 + up to $19,000 in commissions for their first year if all sales goals are met. The account manager role offers an uncapped bonus potential. Individual starting salary within this range may depend on geography, experience, expertise, and education/training. In addition to salary, we offer:  

  

  

  



* Medical/Dental/Vision coverage effective on your first day of employment
* 401(k) plan with dollar-for-dollar matching, up to 6% matching, up to 6% match and fully vested after one year of employment.
* Generous Paid Time Off policy and holidays including two days to give back to your local community.
* Paid parental leave, sabbaticals, military leave.
* Education reimbursement and student loan assistance.
* Up to five days per year of back-up daycare.
* Life, accident and disability insurance.
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company-paid wellness screenings.
* Opportunities for growth – shift careers, support your professional development, or get assigned to any of the 120+ countries in which we operate.

WHAT YOU NEED IS:


* High School Diploma or GED required
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred or equivalent work experience
* At least three years of outside sales experience – preferably in an environment with set targets
* Hands-on attitude – you'll be demonstrating our tools to our customers, using platforms such as Salesforce to keep track of everything, and collaborate with a variety of departments
* Maintain a valid driver’s license – we'll provide you with a company car, be sure you’re ready to drive
* Excellent time and territory management skills
* Must be able to walk on construction projects, climb scaffolding, and lift as much as 65 pounds at any given time
* Work a flexible and varied schedule

WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY?


We are committed to caring for our people, which is why our retention has been over 90% for the last five years. It’s why we haven’t gone through any waves of layoffs – even during the COVID-19 pandemic. We value development, which is why 80-90% of our roles are filled internally. It’s why most of our account managers come from a non-construction background.
  

  

Success at Hilti comes down to teamwork and ability – the Hilti culture is contagious, and we have an excellent mix of people who are always looking to help one another.
  

This job is #LI-Hybrid, meaning it is field-based and requires daily customer in-person interaction with your home serving as your office location


Hilti, Inc is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.


**APPLY NOW**


**Share****Save****Be Where You Belong**
-----------------------

Find your future in a market-leading business with a truly caring and performance-driven culture.


**Who We Are**


**Explore your strengths**
--------------------------

Here at Hilti, we focus on potential over track record, giving you the chance to build on your strengths and grow your skills


**Who We Are**


**Build a better future**
-------------------------

Ever since our foundation, we have focused on innovation to drive our success and help build a better future for our customers.


**How We Work**

title: RN Home Care - Long Island, NY
description:
As a **Nurse** at Avalanche Care, you will play a pivotal role in delivering high-quality healthcare services to our patients. Your primary responsibility will be to establish and maintain comprehensive care plans for your assigned caseload, ensuring that each patient receives personalized attention and support tailored to their unique needs.

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of patient assessments, interventions, and progress notes.
* Communicate effectively with Case Managers and Nurse Case Manager Assistants, providing timely updates on visit schedules, missed visits, schedule changes, and potential discharges.

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

title: Advancement Officer
description:
**UNITED WAY OF NORTHERN NEW JERSEY**

**Advancement Officer**

**Organization overview:**

United Way of Northern New Jersey is seeking an Advancement Officer to support its work to achieve racial and economic equity for those individuals and families struggling to make ends meet, including **ALICE**® (**A\\*sset** L**imited,** I**ncome** C**onstrained,** E\\*mployed) and those in poverty.

**Diversity Statement:**

United Way of Northern New Jersey *celebrates diversity and believes it makes us stronger. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered. We actively encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including underrepresented groups. Our goal is to foster a workplace that reflects the rich tapestry of human experiences, perspectives, and talents. Join us as we build a diverse and vibrant team!*

United Way of Northern New Jersey is one of 1,800 United Ways around the world. Each United Way is an independent entity that serves a specific community. This United Way is unlike any other in the country, running both a national research organization called United For ALICE as well as serving community needs across a five-county region including Morris, Somerset, Suburban Essex, Sussex, and Warren counties.

The funds raised by this United Way are invested in unbiased data insights, innovative solutions, and on-the- ground impact to address financial hardship, improving life for ALICE and all.

**Department: Equity & Innovation**

**Reports to: Chief Equity & Innovations Officer**

**Broad Function/Purpose:**

The Advancement Officer plays a key role in sustaining the financial health and growth of the organization through effective resource mobilization and relationship-building with key stakeholders. They must be strategic thinkers, adept at networking and relationship-building, and have strong communication skills to represent the organization effectively in external settings.

The Advancement Officer is responsible for sustaining and expanding programs/assets to support the organization's mission and strategic goals. This includes developing and implementing strategies to raise money from impact investors and other external stakeholders, while also innovating and overseeing long term stability of strategic projects. They are also part of the team that leads the national ALICE movement focused on changing the narrative and tools we use to measure financial hardship in our country. They must possess an obvious drive for the mission of ALICE (Asset, Limited, Income, Constrained, Employed).

**Primary Responsibilities:**

· Recommending innovative solutions for long term goals of key initiatives

· Raising money from new and unique sources

· Cultivating relationships with high profile partners

· Managing Grant stewardship activities

· Identifying and pursuing grant opportunities

title: Service Coordinator/CSR Specialist
description:
**Service Coordinator & CSR Specialist**

Quality Refrigeration is a fast-paced, growing commercial and industrial refrigeration company based in Hunterdon County. We are looking for an experienced Service Coordinator & CSR Specialist to join our team. As a multi-generational, family-run business, we pride ourselves on reliably providing quality service to every client, regardless of the challenges.

**Summary:** The Service Coordinator & CSR Specialist play a vital role in the day-to-day functions of our service department. This role will work closely with the Service Manager, coordinating technician jobs, dispatching technicians in the field, and ensuring smooth operations within the service department. Additionally, this position will collaborate with other departments to ensure all processes align with company goals. The ideal candidate is motivated, a team player, and can deliver outstanding customer service in a professional manner. A proactive, positive self-starter with excellent organizational skills will thrive in this role.

This is a full-time, on-site position at our Flemington office.

**Essential Functions:**

* Oversee daily operations of the service department
* Coordinate technician jobs and dispatch them efficiently
* Familiarize with our job management software, Service Titan, to optimize and implement features for a more efficient work environment
* Handle and track tasks within Service Titan, including:
* Communicate with technicians in the field for dispatch
* Promptly return customer phone calls and provide updates on technician arrival times
* Set reminders for customers and follow up on services
* Coordinate customer concerns and ensure timely resolution
* Maintain organized accounts of all parts on order and follow up with vendors and customers
* Effectively schedule part installations
* Encourage customers to sign up for service and preventative maintenance contracts
* Schedule quarterly PM cleanings for contracted customers
* Follow up bi-annually to ensure customer satisfaction and contract renewals
* Develop promotions for the service department and manage social media postings
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure cohesive operations

**Compensation:** $24-$32 per hour (special consideration for highly qualified candidates)

**Benefits:**

* 401(k) with employer match
* Flexible schedule

* 7am-4pm; Accessibility to phones until 5 pm

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma required
* 5+ years of dispatching experience (preferred)
* 5+ years of customer service experience (preferred)
* ServiceTitan or related software experience
* Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills
* Innovative, adaptable, and collaborative traits
* Must be a team player with the ability to communicate in a productive and professional manner

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**About Us:**

Positive Promotions is a Long Island based industry leader providing imprinted promotional products to schools, health care and corporate clients. We are the one stop shopping source for over 62 annual events, educational and recognition programs. Positive Promotions both manufactures and distributes world class promotional products and sells both retail and wholesale to other nationwide distributors.

**Job Description**

At Positive Promotions marketing is about understanding the marketplace and building a marketing campaign to demonstrate how our products and services can satisfy the customers needs. We are looking for an experienced and versatile marketing manager who has a proven track record and is passionate about marketing.

Our ideal candidate has experience developing and executing marketing campaigns, which includes market research, merchandising & paginating catalogs along with digital marketing initiatives. The manager will be comfortable with day-to-day marketing activities, as well as long-term strategy, thriving with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

If you are a people-person who loves the rewarding challenge of building a marketing campaign, we want to hear from you!

**Objectives**

* Establish positioning, identify target audiences, and develop marketing plans with specific objectives.
* Lead the execution of marketing programs from start to finish, leveraging internal support and driving collaboration with all teams within the organization to produce a campaign catalog.
* Analyze customer insights, consumer trends, market analysis, and marketing best practices to build successful strategies.
* Create, maintain, and conduct analytics reporting and extract key insights for future campaign development and go-to-market strategies, complete with recommendations on tactics.

**Daily and Monthly Responsibilities**

* Merchandise catalog and work in partnership with the various teams; research, creative, product development and supply chain, to meet the objectives for the catalog creation within the campaign.
* Gather and develop customer and market insights, increase customer conversions, and generate qualified leads.
* Present ideas and final deliverables with senior leaders about campaign programs and strategies.

**Skills and Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or related field.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Detail oriented.
* Ability to work in a deadline-oriented environment.
* Proven experience developing marketing campaigns.
* Strong project management, multitasking, and decision-making skills
* Metrics-driven marketing mind with eye for creativity
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Willingness and ability to travel.
* Experience in catalog/direct mail marketing a plus
* Working knowledge of InDesign an added plus

title: Server
description:
The WOW Factor is What Sets Us Apart from the Others!

We are seeking an **experienced Food Server with open availability to work at-least 4 shifts a week including weekends!** You must be passionate about hospitality and serving our guests, someone that appreciates Southern Italian cuisine and enjoys creating an inviting and warm environment, where you are the experience! If you have a truly sales-oriented personality, can thrive in a high volume environment, have a bright and positive attitude then we are looking for you to join our team! The Ideal candidates will have strong, food and beverage knowledge and can work well under pressure in a team-oriented environment. **This is a Server job that really pays and it's very competitive, you will have the opportunity to make up to $1,200 to 1,600 per week!**

**Your Role with Us:**

* Offer exceptional hospitality to each guest that walks through our doors and delivers Carmine’s family style dining experience.
* Greet guests in a timely and professional manner and take their orders while consistently using suggestive selling techniques.
* Act as a Brand Ambassador, engaging the guest about both Carmine’s and Virgil’s locations and inviting them back again for Special Events and Catering experiences.
* Consistently delivering a high level of customer service to each guest and maintain a safe environment.
* Collaborate with kitchen staff to ensure that food orders are accurate.
* Delivering food orders from the kitchen to guests' tables rapidly and accurately; all Server’s may be scheduled for food runner shifts.
* Serve food and beverage orders within established time frames once the entire order is complete.
* Complete all side work necessary at the end of every shift.
* Work with the entire team in the front of the house and the kitchen to ensure the guest has the best possible experience.

**We Are Looking for Candidates:**

* With Server experience in a high-volume full-service restaurant environment.
* Who are professional, personable, organized with a sense of humor and a strong passion for hospitality.
* Who are experienced in service, exhibit salesmanship, enjoy a fast-paced team environment, and thrive on creating exceptional guest experiences.
* With Knowledge of fine wine & spirits.
* Who are fluent in English.
* With open flexibility to work various shifts.

**The Perks:**

* Exciting Career Paths
* Competitive Compensation
* Supportive Team Environment
* Medical & Dental Coverage
* Paid Time Off
* Free delicious employee family meals
* Employee discount in all our restaurants

\\*We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Maintenance Manager
description:
SDK Village Green Apartments, a premier apartment community located in Budd Lake, NJ is looking for a Maintenance Manager to join our team. We seek someone with exceptional customer service skills who is looking to be a part of a dynamic team. Must be dependable and have a clean driving record. Embracing the SDK philosophy, you will exhibit excellent customer service skills; treating our residents with dignity, respect, and a desire to provide the highest standard of quality and comfort in their homes.

**Essential Job Function:**

* Partner with office counterpart(s) to ensure effective operations.
* Implement and manage programs to maximize revenue, control expenses and improve resident satisfaction.
* Manage all property vendor contracts (cost, scope compliance, etc.) as well as managing any vendor on site day to day.
* Manage all service request; including prioritization and delegation to assigned staff. Maintain parts and supply inventory to ensure company customer service standards are maintained.
* Manage maintenance to ensure the physical condition of the property is maintained and contributes to SDK’s annual business goals.
* Manage apartment preparations and renovations in a timely manner for a strong rental.
* Manage the apartment home turnover and preventive maintenance programs schedules to maximize the value to the community and ensure the quality of work. Assess the value of damage to apartment homes that are charged to departing resident.
* Ensure implementation of appropriate risk mitigation procedures, including disaster response and safety training; maintain appropriate documentation.
* Monitor maintenance expenses ensuring spending is approved and within budget.
* Manage all personnel duties including scheduling work assignments, performance evaluations, associate training and development and disciplinary actions; make recommendations regarding hiring and termination.
* Inspect grounds, buildings and apartment homes on a regular basis to ensure that all physical aspects of the community are fully functional at all times; perform start-up duties and acceptance walks as required.
* Oversee execution of work of external maintenance vendors and internal maintenance service suppliers.
* Implement or direct the implementation of all applicable SDK policies and procedures. Ensure compliance as needed.
* Ensure compliance with all federal, state and local laws.

**Qualifications**

* High School Diploma or equivalent (GED)
* 3 to 5 years of experience working in multi-family property management or other building maintenance experience performing the duties of Maintenance Supervisor or Maintenance Technician.
* Ability to read and write English as demonstrated by clear and concise written and verbal communications. Demonstrated ability to create and deliver group presentations on property subject matter and to write reports in a clear, concise form.
* Ability to frequently operate general office equipment such as estimating, determining averages and percentages.
* Ability to frequently operate general office equipment such as, but no limited to, personal computer, telephone, photocopying machine, facsimile machine and postage machine.
* Ability to supervise and develop new associates and provide feedback and coaching resulting in improved performance as demonstrated by work experience.
* Ability to frequently use general maintenance tools, supplies, and equipment such as, but not limited to, hand tools, pressure washers, blowers, paint equipment, pool chemicals, ice removal equipment, ladders, freon recovery units, landscaping equipment, sandblasters, and safety equipment.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
* Knowledge of RealPage Onesite software systems is a plus!

Our comprehensive **benefits** package includes**:**

* Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits
* Life and LTD Insurance
* Paid Holidays
* Paid Vacation Time
* Paid Sick Time
* Company match 401k Plan
* Apartment Discount

Salary per year plus Bonus

Weill Cornell Medicine is a comprehensive academic medical center that is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery, and the education of future physicians and scientists in New York City and around the world. Our doctors and scientists - faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and the Weill Cornell Physician Organization - are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Our medical practices serve communities throughout New York City, and our faculty provide comprehensive care at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Brooklyn Methodist Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Westchester Behavioral Health Center, and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. At Weill Cornell Medicine, we work together to treat each individual, not just their conditions or illnesses, as we strive to deliver the finest possible care for our patients - the center of everything we do. title: Data Analyst for Project Management Team (VBC) Remote
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who seek it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Duchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. We are currently seeking a full-time Data Analyst for the Project Management team (Value-Based Care) to join our team remotely.


The Data Analyst will be responsible for leveraging Sun River Health’s available data to provide a clear understanding of Sun River Health’s performance in value-based payment contracts, beginning with MVP, to drive performance improvement.


**Essential Functions**

* Leverage data from the ARC Tool, the ROI Tool, and elsewhere to provide a clear, transparent view of Sun River Health’s performance in value-based payment contracts, beginning with MVP.
* Develop materials –reports and presentations for a variety of audiences that promote Sun River Health’s performance management and improvement work within these contracts.
* Analyze data for the purposes of evaluations and improving reporting, transparency, and company goals.
* Participate in project management meetings, develop reports based on assigned projects.
* Provide project management support for key Sun River initiatives.

**Education:**

* Bachelor's Degree required, Master's Degree preferred

Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.  



Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $21.50 - $24.50 per hour


Location: Remote (must reside NY, CT, NJ, PA)
company_description: At Sun River Health, we believe that quality, complete health care is for everyone, no matter what you can pay.

description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who seek it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Duchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. We are currently seeking a full-time Director of Project Management for Value-Based Care to join our team remotely.


The Director of Project Management for Value-Based Care is directly responsible for monitoring Sun River Health’s performance in our value-based payment contract with MVP.


**Essential Functions**

* Ensuring the strategic alignment of Sun River Health’s Value Transformation process across the North Star and organizational landscapes, including coordination with other value-driven and process improvement work, like the Community Health Center Excellence and Coleman Associates processes.
* Leveraging data for ongoing performance management within Sun River Health’s value-based payment contracts, beginning with MVP and MSSP.
* Identifying opportunities for performance and process improvements within the above arrangements and supporting the design, implementation, and monitoring of these QI projects.
* Monitoring the roll-out of Sun River Health’s Value Transformation Implementation Plan and performing all necessary quality assurance functions.
